radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) of the head
radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple (at least eight) small hyperintense lesions scattered throughout both cerebral hemispheres; largest lesion is 7 mm in the left centrum semiovale, suggestive of infarcts that occurred at least 6 hours earlier.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat MRI revealed multiple foci of restricted diffusion, with new foci in the bilateral frontal and right occipital lobes, consistent with multiple small acute infarcts.

radiographic_examinations.findings: No evidence of deep venous thrombosis.
Hyperkinetic left ventricle without wall-motion abnormalities; right ventricular apex akinetic and aneurysmal; accumulation of sessile, smooth-bordered endocardial material.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Echocardiographic abnormalities had resolved almost completely within 6 weeks after discharge.
